meanings.definition: To set or place in a setting
meanings.sent1: She carefully enchased the diamond in the ring.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler will enchase the gemstone in the necklace.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to enchase the rare stone in the sculpture for a unique touch.
meanings.sent4: Her smile enchased the moment in his memory forever.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays enchased the mountain peaks with a golden glow.

meanings.definition: To decorate with inlays or embossing
meanings.sent1: He wanted to enchase the wooden box with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman will enchase the metal frame with delicate designs.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to enchase the cake with edible flowers but it didn't turn out well.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to enchase the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight enchased the garden with a magical shimmer.
